name: Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott Newark Liberty International Airport

reviews.text: We all look forward to our vacations since most of us are stuck in the rat race and only get 2 weeks out of the year to actually relax. Needless to say that when we're suppossed to be enjoying our time off we're to busy worrying about what can go wrong, how we're getting to the airport or if we forgot anything. I was a little skeptical about staying at the Fairfield because i'm a loyal Starwood customer, but a friend recommended it so i gave it a shot. It was great from the start. We decided to do the Park & Fly package, so we drove to the hotel. Well, we were lost for about 20 minutes and decided to call the hotel for directions. The front desk personnel stayed on the phone with us until we were in front of the hotel. After that it was smooth sailing. The Staff was excellent, from the front desk to the breakfast attendants. The rooms were clean, they provided coffee service all hours of the night and they had an indoor pool which tired out our kids which got them to bed nice and early. This is my hotel of choice when flying out of Newark Airport, at least i know i have one less thing to worry about.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel while chaperoning a class trip. The hotel was clean and the employees friendly. They had a nice breakfast, with many choices. Quiet and safe.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and felt very comfortable at the Fairfield Inn. We stayed there over New Years weekend as we went into the city for the ball drop. We were pleased with the service they provided us. We were happy with the room- although not very glamorous or extravigant but practical. I read many reviews before we left and I was a bit nervous. Most of them said it was hard to get to the hotal and believe me- it was! It comes up quick and the signs aren't huge on the side of the road so you easily pass it. I heard that the mattress was hard and not comfortable but I found it very nice. It is all a matter of opinion.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The only problem we did have was the whirlpool did not work 2 out of the 4 nights we were there. The hotel staff tried but something was seriously wrong with it.
reviews.title: Excellent experience - recommended

reviews.text: Fairfield Inn has a wonderful continential breakfast. It was not your ordinary bagels and muffins. They had make your own waffles, pastries, cereal, english muffins, fresh fruit...and the list goes on.
reviews.title: Liked it here
You better have a car if you want to eat!
reviews.text: The shuttle system really works out great especially if you are going to the city. It is a long trip into the city but flawless. You hop on the shuttle which brings you to the AirTran (get off at Continential Air). The Air Tran is free and brings you to the New Jersey train station where you catch a train to Penn Station in New York. You could also get the PATH which is $1.50 per person each trip and go to PENN Station or the World Trade Center. If you are a tourist I would recommend TWC because you ride in to (under as well)where the Twin Towers were.
Overall I was very happy with our room and the level of service they provided and I would recommend this along with other Fairfield Inn's to anyone.
reviews.title: It's Newark, what do you expect?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very friendly (how did New Jerseyites get such a bad reputation?!?) and check in was efficient. I had a great night's rest, adequate breakfast, and have nothing negative to say about this property - I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Night before Flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rarely even at high end hotels are the staff as nice and attentive as these people. The young man from Columbia who checked us in made sure we had a quiet room, and even changed room types to ensure this. Also, the beds were quite comfortable for a Fairfield. This is an above average Fairfield, very convenient to the airport. Make sure you have PRINTED directions from the website to get to the hotel. Gettting to the airport however, was super easy.
reviews.title: Great staff, beds and quiet!

reviews.text: I've stayed at a lot of Fairfield Inns and usually have a good experience however this is absolutely the worst one! Our room was musty and the air conditioner would not turn off. Our (older) children's room the HEATER was on and it was AUGUST! We exchanged rooms since they love the cold but it took forever to get it cool. The sheets were ratty and the blankets had holes in it. Our TV did not work well. The room was clean but very musty. The delievery food recommended in their book was closed (it was Sunday). THey did advertise sandwiches in the lobby & other things but I went down their and they said they didn't have any. (We were too tired to go out) The desk clerk was in a hurry to get rid of me (He was talking to an angry guest!) so he handed me another brochure for pizza. When it arrived, it was SO bad (and we aren't picky) that no one wanted to eat it. Ok shouldn't be the hotel's fault but they recommended it!
reviews.title: The Worst Fairfield Inn!

reviews.text: One last thing...the wakeup service didn't wake us up. I didn't sleep much anyway because of the AWFUL - and I mean AWFUL mattress...so its a good thing I was awake or we could have missed the plane!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel
A good choice for Newark EWR
reviews.text: This a good choice for a quick overnight stay before or after a flight into/out of Newark. To get to the hotel you need to catch the airtrain monorail to P4 (parking station) from your terminal, The courtesy hotel shuttle was there in less than 10 mins. It was a bouncy ride to the hotel but otherwise fine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was swift (not over friendly but courteous and efficient which is all I need) The room had a king bed and a very clean bright bathroom. Both bed and linens were comfortable.
reviews.title: Perfect choice

likes.liked: — Proximity to the airport and New York City, free shuttle to and from airport, friendly and accomdating staff
likes.disliked: — Lack of restaurants or other businesses in walking distance of hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast is served near the lobby - I had a fresh bagel and coffee which was fine and good enough to wake me up! Typical menu available in all these hotel types.
reviews.title: Adequate.

reviews.text: Coffee and tea was available from the lobby along with cookies - a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Paid $135 for the one night (compared with the Marriott which wanted $300 for the night it wasn't a difficult choice although I do like the Marriott too) Given that everything was clean and worked well, I consider this a great choice for the money. Will use again if visiting EWR.
reviews.title: Great property and staff

likes.liked: — staff and cleanliness of rooms, free internet

aka: Fairfield Inn And Suites By Marriott Newark Liberty International Airport
